content.title: Swatantrata Sainik Samman Pension Scheme
content.details: Launched on 15th August 1972, 'Swatantrata Sainik Samman Pension Scheme' is a Pension Scheme by the Ministry of Home Affairs. The scheme provides the grant of pension to living freedom fighters and their families; if they are no more alive, and to the families or martyrs. The benefits of the pension scheme are extended to all freedom fighters as a token of SAMMAN to them.
benefits: Total Amount of Pension Including 3% DR for Ex-Andaman Political/Prisoners/Spouses: ₹30,900/-
Basic Pension for Freedom Fighters Who Suffered Outside British India/Spouses: ₹28,000/-
Total Amount of Pension Including 3% DR for Freedom Fighters Who Suffered Outside British India/Spouses: ₹28,840/-
Basic Pension for Other Freedom Fighters/spouses including INA: ₹26,000/-
Total Amount of Pension Including 3% DR for Other Freedom Fighters/spouses including INA: ₹26,780/-
Basic Pension for Dependent parents/eligible daughters: 50% of the sum that would have been admissible to the Freedom Fighter (₹13,000/- to ₹15,000/-)
Total Amount of Pension Including 3% DR for Dependent parents/eligible daughters: 50% of the sum that would have been admissible to the Freedom Fighter (₹13,390/- to ₹15,450/-)
eligibility: A person who had suffered a minimum imprisonment of six months in the mainland jails before Independence.
Ex-INA personnel will be eligible for pension if the imprisonment/detention suffered by them was outside India.
The minimum period of actual imprisonment for pension eligibility has been reduced to three months, in the case of women and SC/ST freedom fighters from 01.08.1980.
For the purpose of granting Samman pension, the family includes mother, father, widower/widow if he/she has not since remarried, and unmarried daughters.
Not more than one eligible dependent can be granted a pension.
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant should request a free copy of the prescribed application form from either the State Government/UT concerned or Freedom Fighters’ Division, Ministry of Home Affairs, New Delhi.
documents_required: Certificate from the concerned jail authorities or District Magistrates.
Orders of confiscation and sale of property.

faqs.question: What identification documents are needed at the time of receiving the pension?
faqs.answer: Identification documents include a photograph, two prominent identification marks, specimen signature or thumb impressions duly attested, and date of birth.

faqs.question: Where should the second copy of the application form be sent as an advance copy?
faqs.answer: The second copy should be sent to the Deputy Secretary to the Government of India, Freedom Fighters Division, Ministry of Home Affairs, New Delhi.

faqs.question: How can interested applicants obtain the application form for the pension scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can request a free copy of the prescribed application form from either the State Government/UT concerned or the Freedom Fighters’ Division, Ministry of Home Affairs, New Delhi.
